channel.title: How do i make kbd harder?
channel.description: ok, i want him like level 400 and like have 500 hp, cuz he has really good drops, but, idk were to change this,i went into config, then npc's and edited his "combat" and "hp" levels, then complied and ran, still aint working, hes still 274 or w.e level normal kbd's are...

item.title: How do i make kbd harder?
item.dc:creator: @b15 b15
item.description:
@b15 wrote:

because we want to make it challenging to kill not to get drops. my method is a more professional way of making npc harder to kill but you will have a reward at the end of the kill. players will get pissed off if they keep killing and get no drops. i would know i have a server with 250+ people on it. i know what pisses people off. i cant mention the name of it or its advertising. anyways

Read full topic

item.source: How do i make kbd harder?

item.title: How do i make kbd harder?
item.dc:creator: @ameer122 ameer122
item.description:
@ameer122 wrote:

[quote=“b15, post:13, topic:358119”]ok im going to try to each u something.

ok look at the first section of the command

if(plr.playerEquipment[plr.playerShield] == 1540 || plr.playerEquipment[plr.playerShield] == 2621 || plr.ProtMage) {
plr.specGFX(396);
hitDiff = 3 + misc.random(7);
plr.EntangleDelay = 10;
plr.sM("You have been frozen!");

this clip below says that if a player IS wielding item 1540 (DFS) or wielding 2621 (AFS) and has mage protection on.

if(plr.playerEquipment[plr.playerShield] == 1540 || plr.playerEquipment[plr.playerShield] == 2621

ok so if u want to change how much the dragon will hit with a AFS or a DFS u want to modify this line:

hitDiff = 3 + misc.random(7);

ok so this command above tells you that the dragon will hit a max of 10 ok so if u want to increase its max change the " misc.random(7);" to a higher number.
example " misc.random(30);" so now its max will be a 33 etc.

ok now for the second part of the script.

else if(plr.playerEquipment[plr.playerShield] != 1540 || plr.playerEquipment[plr.playerShield] != 2621) {

the code above has a ! mark before the number 1540, and 2621. that means the player is not wielding those ids.

ok so the code under

else if(plr.playerEquipment[plr.playerShield] != 1540 || plr.playerEquipment[plr.playerShield] != 2621) {

ok the code under here is what the dragon will hit on u when u do not have the shields. (when u are not protected by the fire breath)

hitDiff = 20 + misc.random(30);

so that code above means that the dragon will hit max of a 50 on you if u dont have a shield[/quote]
good coder realy

where to add this ?

Read full topic
item.source: How do i make kbd harder?

item.description:

[quote=“b15, post:13, topic:358119”]ok im going to try to each u something.

ok look at the first section of the command

if(plr.playerEquipment[plr.playerShield] == 1540 || plr.playerEquipment[plr.playerShield] == 2621 || plr.ProtMage) {
plr.specGFX(396);
hitDiff = 3 + misc.random(7);
plr.EntangleDelay = 10;
plr.sM("You have been frozen!");

this clip below says that if a player IS wielding item 1540 (DFS) or wielding 2621 (AFS) and has mage protection on.

if(plr.playerEquipment[plr.playerShield] == 1540 || plr.playerEquipment[plr.playerShield] == 2621

ok so if u want to change how much the dragon will hit with a AFS or a DFS u want to modify this line:

hitDiff = 3 + misc.random(7);

ok so this command above tells you that the dragon will hit a max of 10 ok so if u want to increase its max change the " misc.random(7);" to a higher number.
example " misc.random(30);" so now its max will be a 33 etc.

ok now for the second part of the script.

else if(plr.playerEquipment[plr.playerShield] != 1540 || plr.playerEquipment[plr.playerShield] != 2621) {

the code above has a ! mark before the number 1540, and 2621. that means the player is not wielding those ids.

ok so the code under

else if(plr.playerEquipment[plr.playerShield] != 1540 || plr.playerEquipment[plr.playerShield] != 2621) {

ok the code under here is what the dragon will hit on u when u do not have the shields. (when u are not protected by the fire breath)

hitDiff = 20 + misc.random(30);

so that code above means that the dragon will hit max of a 50 on you if u dont have a shield[/quote]

Thanks alot! That really helped!

item.title: How do i make kbd harder?
item.dc:creator: @b15 b15
item.description:
@b15 wrote:

ok im going to try to each u something.

ok look at the first section of the command

if(plr.playerEquipment[plr.playerShield] == 1540 || plr.playerEquipment[plr.playerShield] == 2621 || plr.ProtMage) {
plr.specGFX(396);
hitDiff = 3 + misc.random(7);
plr.EntangleDelay = 10;
plr.sM("You have been frozen!");

this clip below says that if a player IS wielding item 1540 (DFS) or wielding 2621 (AFS) and has mage protection on.

if(plr.playerEquipment[plr.playerShield] == 1540 || plr.playerEquipment[plr.playerShield] == 2621

ok so if u want to change how much the dragon will hit with a AFS or a DFS u want to modify this line:

hitDiff = 3 + misc.random(7);

ok so this command above tells you that the dragon will hit a max of 10 ok so if u want to increase its max change the " misc.random(7);" to a higher number.
example " misc.random(30);" so now its max will be a 33 etc.

ok now for the second part of the script.

else if(plr.playerEquipment[plr.playerShield] != 1540 || plr.playerEquipment[plr.playerShield] != 2621) {

the code above has a ! mark before the number 1540, and 2621. that means the player is not wielding those ids.

ok so the code under

else if(plr.playerEquipment[plr.playerShield] != 1540 || plr.playerEquipment[plr.playerShield] != 2621) {

ok the code under here is what the dragon will hit on u when u do not have the shields. (when u are not protected by the fire breath)

hitDiff = 20 + misc.random(30);

so that code above means that the dragon will hit max of a 50 on you if u dont have a shield

item.title: How do i make kbd harder?
item.dc:creator: @Acrodox Acrodox
item.description:
@Acrodox wrote:

[quote=“i0wn3v3ry, post:7, topic:358119”]To make him hit hard, look in Npchandler.java –

} else if(npcs[NPCID].npcType == 50 && misc.random(3)==1){
if(plr.playerEquipment[plr.playerShield] == 1540 || plr.playerEquipment[plr.playerShield] == 2621 || plr.ProtMage) {
plr.specGFX(396);
hitDiff = 3 + misc.random(7);
plr.EntangleDelay = 10;
plr.sM(“You have been frozen!”);
} else if(plr.playerEquipment[plr.playerShield] != 1540 || plr.playerEquipment[plr.playerShield] != 2621) {
plr.specGFX(396);
hitDiff = 20 + misc.random(30);
plr.EntangleDelay = 10;
plr.sM(“You have been frozen!”);}

Thats for mage I believe.
Edit to fit yours, if its what your looking for.[/quote]

what do i edit in:

} else if(npcs[NPCID].npcType == 50 && misc.random(3)==1){ if(plr.playerEquipment[plr.playerShield] == 1540 || plr.playerEquipment[plr.playerShield] == 2621 || plr.ProtMage) { plr.specGFX(396); hitDiff = 3 + misc.random(7); plr.EntangleDelay = 10; plr.sM("You have been frozen!"); } else if(plr.playerEquipment[plr.playerShield] != 1540 || plr.playerEquipment[plr.playerShield] != 2621) { plr.specGFX(396); hitDiff = 20 + misc.random(30); plr.EntangleDelay = 10; plr.sM("You have been frozen!");}

to make him hit harder?
